噶.definition: phonetic ga (used in rendering Tibetan and Mongolian sounds); Tibetan Ge: language of Buddha; (dialect) final particle similar to 了[le5] (esp. in Yunnan)

噶哈巫族.definition: Kaxabu or Kahabu, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

噶拉·多傑·仁波切.pinyin: Ga2 la1 · Duo1 jie2 · Ren2 bo1 qie4
噶拉·多傑·仁波切.definition: Garab Dorje Rinpoche, succession of Buthanese religious leaders

噶爾.definition: Gar county in Ngari prefecture, Tibet, Tibetan: Sgar rdzong

噶爾縣.definition: Gar county in Ngari prefecture, Tibet, Tibetan: Sgar rdzong

噶瑪蘭.definition: Kavalan, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan; old name of Yilan 宜蘭|宜兰[Yi2 lan2] County, Taiwan; Kavalan, a brand of single malt whisky from Taiwan

噶瑪蘭族.definition: Kavalan, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

噶舉派.definition: Geju (Tibetan: transmit word of Buddha) sect of Tibetan Buddhist

噶隆.definition: Tibetan government official; same as 噶布倫|噶布伦
